summary: Production-ready full-stack personal finance management platform with secure JWT authentication, income/expense tracking, budget management, financial analytics, and modern responsive UI
architectural_notes: Tech stack: React (Vite/Next.js) + TypeScript, Tailwind CSS + Framer Motion, Node.js + Express, MongoDB + Mongoose
Clean MVC architecture with RESTful API structure
JWT authentication: access + refresh tokens stored in HTTP-only secure cookies
MongoDB schemas: Users, Income, Expenses with Mongoose relationships (User → Income/Expenses)
Input validation using Joi or Zod
Environment variables for JWT secret & MongoDB URI
Folder structure: controllers, routes, models, middleware
Portfolio-ready with README, setup & deployment instructions

existing_features.title: Implement user authentication system with Internet Identity integration for secure login and registration, ensuring each user can only access their own financial data
Create income management functionality allowing users to add, update, and delete income entries with predefined categories including Salary, Business, Investments, Extra income, and Deposits
Implement balance calculation displaying Total Income, Total Expenses, and Current Balance (Income - Expenses) with real-time updates as transactions are added, edited, or deleted

Create dashboard with visual breakdown of income and expenses by category using donut charts showing percentage distribution, matching the reference image layout with Income card on left, Expenses card on right, and Total Balance prominently displayed

Implement transaction list view displaying all income and expense entries with amount in rupees, category, date, and delete functionality with icon, matching the reference image transaction list design

Create modal form for adding transactions with fields for Type (Income/Expense dropdown), Category dropdown, Amount input, and Date picker, with CREATE button, matching the reference image modal design
Implement monthly and yearly financial summaries showing aggregated income, expenses, and balance for selected time periods
Calculate and display Financial Health Score based on savings ratio (savings / income), with visual indicator showing score percentage and health status
Implement search and filter functionality for transactions allowing users to filter by category, date range, transaction type (income/expense), and search by amount or description
Add recurring transaction support allowing users to set up automatic repeating income or expense entries with configurable frequency (daily, weekly, monthly, yearly)
Implement budget limit setting feature allowing users to set monthly budget limits per expense category with visual progress indicators

Create budget exceeded notification system that displays toast notifications when user's spending in any category exceeds the set budget limit, and show relevant contextual notifications for other financial events
Implement data export to CSV functionality allowing users to download their transaction history with all fields (date, type, category, amount, description) in CSV format
Create expense prediction feature that calculates and displays predicted expenses for the next month based on average spending from previous months
Implement dark and light mode toggle with persistent user preference, applying theme consistently across all components and views
Ensure fully responsive UI design that adapts seamlessly to mobile, tablet, and desktop screen sizes with optimized layouts for each breakpoint
Design a modern, catchy UI with a creative visual theme using non-blue-purple color schemes, incorporating smooth animations and polished interactions that create a premium, portfolio-ready aesthetic
Fix the IncomeChart component to remove or properly handle the '0' display that appears over the income chart visualization

Expand the income categories beyond the current 5 categories (Salary, Business, Investments, Extra income, Deposits) to include additional common income sources such as Rental Income, Freelance, Dividends, Interest, Bonuses, Gifts, and Refunds

Expand the expense categories beyond the current 7 categories (Bills, Car, Clothes, Travel, Shopping, House, Entertainment) to include additional common expense types such as Food & Dining, Healthcare, Education, Insurance, Utilities, Subscriptions, Personal Care, Pets, and Miscellaneous

Build recurring transactions management page replacing the current placeholder RecurringTransactionsPage with a list of all recurring transactions showing type, category, amount, frequency, next due date, and active status with action buttons for edit, delete, and toggle active status

Create add/edit recurring transaction modal with fields for transaction type (income/expense), category dropdown, amount, description, frequency selector (daily/weekly/monthly/yearly), start date, optional end date, and save button

Implement notification system that displays toast notifications when significant income is added (above a threshold like 10,000 rupees), when significant expenses are recorded (above a threshold like 5,000 rupees), and when overall balance falls below a low threshold (like 1,000 rupees)
Add notification when recurring transactions are automatically executed, showing the transaction type, category, amount, and confirming it was added from a recurring template

Create React Query hooks for recurring transactions including useRecurringTransactions for fetching all recurring transactions, useAddRecurringTransaction for creating new recurring transactions, useUpdateRecurringTransaction for editing, useDeleteRecurringTransaction for deletion, and useToggleRecurringTransaction for activating/deactivating
